Uses of Class
org.jugsaxony.treed.api.Bulb

  • Packages that use Bulb 
    Package Description
    org.jugsaxony.treed
    TreeD is a Christmas project of JUG Saxony based on an idea by Matt Parker.
    org.jugsaxony.treed.api
    To implement your own animation (either by implementing AnimationStrategy or by deriving from AbstractBaseAnimationStrategy) you need to know a little bit about the world our tree lives in.
    org.jugsaxony.treed.examples
    Example animations to get inspired by.
    org.jugsaxony.treed.internal
    Animations used to validate parts of the framework, the hardware as well as both simulators.
    org.jugsaxony.treed.root
    Containing the JavaFX simulator for all animations.
    org.jugsaxony.treed.web
    This package and its subpackages are a Spring Boot application that is the backend of the Web simulator of TreeD.

      Methods in org.jugsaxony.treed with parameters of type Bulb 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected void MyStrategy.calcBulb​(Bulb bulb, long timestamp)  

    • Uses of Bulb in org.jugsaxony.treed.api

      Methods in org.jugsaxony.treed.api with parameters of type Bulb 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected abstract void AbstractBaseAnimationStrategy.calcBulb​(Bulb bulb, long timestamp)
      This method is the essence of most animations.
      double Utils.distance​(Bulb bulb, double x, double y, double z)
      Determines the distance between the position of the bulb and a specific point in 3D space.
      Method parameters in org.jugsaxony.treed.api with type arguments of type Bulb 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void AbstractBaseAnimationStrategy.calcFrame​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      void AnimationStrategy.calcFrame​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)  
      void Utils.fadeAll​(List<Bulb> bulbs, int amount)
      Reducing the brightness of each component of RGB by a specific amount for all bulbs.
      void AbstractBaseAnimationStrategy.onEndAnimation​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      When your animation is ending, this is the last method to be called by the framework.
      void AnimationStrategy.onEndAnimation​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      When your animation is ending, this is the last method to be called by the framework.
      void AbstractBaseAnimationStrategy.onEndFrame​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      If you create a dynamic model of some sort in this method, please be a good citizen and destroy it in #onEndFrame.
      void AnimationStrategy.onEndFrame​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      If you create a dynamic model of some sort in this method, please be a good citizen and destroy it in #onEndFrame.
      void AbstractBaseAnimationStrategy.onStartAnimation​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      Whenever your animation is started, this is the first method to be called by the framework.
      void AnimationStrategy.onStartAnimation​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      Whenever your animation is started, this is the first method to be called by the framework.
      void AbstractBaseAnimationStrategy.onStartFrame​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      The framework will present the animation as a sequence of frames and at the beginning of each frame, this method is called.
      void AnimationStrategy.onStartFrame​(List<Bulb> bulbs, long timestamp)
      The framework will present the animation as a sequence of frames and at the beginning of each frame, this method is called.
